etymology.description: semantic: 火 (fire) + 火 (fire); vertical duplication of 火.
etymology.interpretation: Two fires stacked intensify the idea of heat and blazing flames, yielding senses like flame, hot, and inflammation. Doubling the fire graph conveys an intensified, spreading burn.

examples.chinese: 今天天气炎热(今天天氣炎熱)，请多喝水(請多喝水)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān tiānqì yánrè, qǐng duō hē shuǐ.
examples.english: It’s blazing hot today; please drink more water.

examples.chinese: 嗓子发炎了(嗓子發炎了)，说话会疼(說話會疼)。
examples.pinyin: Sǎngzi fāyán le, shuōhuà huì téng.
examples.english: My throat is inflamed, and it hurts to speak.

examples.chinese: 医生说他有炎症(醫生說他有炎症)，需要消炎药(需要消炎藥)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng shuō tā yǒu yánzhèng, xūyào xiāoyán yào.
examples.english: The doctor said he has inflammation and needs anti-inflammatory medicine.
